seller_research.name: Whatfix
seller_research.description: Whatfix is a digital adoption platform that provides organizations with a no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application that looks 100% native.

pricing_models.description: Whatfix pricing is based on two components: a flat per-application fee, plus user license fees.

buyer_research.name: Marks and Spencer
buyer_research.description: M&S is a leading British retailer bringing quality, great value food, clothing and homeware to millions of customers around the world.
goals: Deliver exceptional quality and value to customers
Be a leader in sustainability and ethics

competitors.name: WalkMe
differentiators: WalkMe's platform overlays on any application

competitors.name: Pendo
cons: Can be complex to implement and manage
differentiators: Pendo's product cloud provides a unified platform
Offers digital adoption solutions for employee software

competitors.name: Userpilot
pros: Helps product teams deliver personalized in-app experiences
Increases growth metrics at every stage of the user journey
cons: May require significant resources to set up and maintain
Can be overwhelming for users with too many features
differentiators: Userpilot's platform drives user activation, feature adoption, and expansion revenue
Offers a resource center for in-app help

pains: How can Whatfix help us deliver exceptional quality and value to our customers?
Can Whatfix's digital adoption platform help us maintain customer loyalty and stay ahead of the competition?
How does Whatfix's solution align with our goals of building a strong, trusted brand and leading in sustainability and ethics?
What kind of support does Whatfix offer to ensure successful implementation and adoption of its platform?
How does Whatfix's pricing model work, and what kind of ROI can we expect?
Can Whatfix's platform integrate with our existing software applications and workflows?
How does Whatfix address issues of user adoption and change management in our organization?
What kind of analytics and insights does Whatfix provide to help us optimize our business outcomes?
How does Whatfix ensure data security and compliance with regulatory requirements?
objections: We are already invested in another digital adoption platform, why should we switch to Whatfix?
Whatfix seems expensive, can you justify the cost?
We have a robust in-house IT team, can't we build our own digital adoption solution?
How does Whatfix's platform differ from WalkMe, Pendo, or Userpilot, and why should we choose Whatfix?
We don't have the resources to dedicate to implementing and managing a new platform like Whatfix.
Whatfix's pricing model seems complex, can you provide a clearer breakdown of the costs?

messages.content: Hi there, I'm [Name], the sales person from Whatfix. It's great to connect with you, [Marks and Spencer's Team Person]. I understand that Marks and Spencer is a leading British retailer focused on delivering exceptional quality and value to customers. Can you tell me a bit more about your current challenges and goals?

Hi [Name], thanks for reaching out. We're indeed committed to delivering the best possible experience for our customers. One of our major challenges is to maintain customer loyalty and stay ahead of the competition. With changing consumer behavior, it's becoming increasingly difficult to ensure our customers have the best possible experience across our various channels.

I completely understand. Digital transformation can be a significant challenge, especially in the retail industry. Have you considered how digital adoption platforms like Whatfix can help you achieve your goals? We've had success with similar organizations in the past, such as [similar organization].

Actually, we've been exploring digital adoption platforms, but we're not sure which one would be the best fit for us. We've looked at WalkMe, Pendo, and Userpilot, but we're still evaluating our options. Can you tell me more about Whatfix's solution and how it differs from these other platforms?

Whatfix is a no-code digital adoption platform that provides in-app guidance to ensure seamless user adoption. Our solution is designed to help organizations like yours accelerate digital transformation, drive user adoption, and maximize technology investments. We've found that our platform is particularly effective in industries with complex software applications, like retail. I'd be happy to walk you through a demo and show you how Whatfix can help address your specific pain points.

That sounds interesting. We'd love to see a demo. But can you also tell me more about the ROI we can expect from implementing Whatfix? We need to ensure that any investment we make will provide tangible business outcomes.

We've seen our customers achieve significant ROI from using Whatfix. For example, [similar organization] saw a 30% increase in user adoption and a 25% reduction in support requests after implementing our platform. We'd be happy to work with you to develop a customized ROI model based on your specific needs and goals.

That's impressive. What kind of support does Whatfix offer to ensure successful implementation and adoption of its platform? We've had issues with training and change management in the past, and we need to ensure that our team is properly equipped to get the most out of the platform.

We understand the importance of proper implementation and adoption. That's why we offer a comprehensive onboarding process, including dedicated customer success managers, training, and support resources. We'll work closely with your team to ensure a smooth transition and provide ongoing support to guarantee your success.
That sounds great. What are the next steps? We're interested in moving forward with Whatfix, but we need to discuss this further with our team and stakeholders.

I'm glad to hear that. I'd be happy to set up a follow-up call to discuss the proposal in more detail and answer any further questions you may have. In the meantime, I'll send over some additional information on Whatfix, including case studies and testimonials from similar organizations. Is there a specific timeline you're working with for implementing a digital adoption platform?

pain_points: ensuring customers have the best possible experience across various channels
objections: unsure about which digital adoption platform to choose
need to ensure tangible business outcomes

They are looking for a digital adoption platform to help them achieve their goals
They are interested in seeing a demo and understanding the ROI of implementing Whatfix
They have concerns about implementation and adoption
improvements: Whatfix should emphasize the benefits of their solution in terms of tangible business outcomes
Whatfix should provide more information on their implementation and adoption process to alleviate concerns
Whatfix should be prepared to address questions about how they differ from competitors

features.name: Digital Adoption Platform
features.description: A no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application that looks 100% native.

features.name: In-app Guidance
features.description: Guides users through the application to achieve business outcomes.

features.name: Analytics
features.description: Provides insights on user behavior to optimize the application experience.

features.name: Mobile Experiences
features.description: Delivers personalized in-app experiences on mobile devices.

features.name: Interactive Guides
features.description: Provides step-by-step instructions to help users complete tasks efficiently.

features.name: On-demand User Support
features.description: Offers users real-time support to resolve issues quickly.

features.name: Customer Contextual Messages
features.description: Displays relevant messages to users based on their actions and behavior.

messages.content: Hello, everyone. Thank you for taking the time to join this demo call today. I'm excited to show you how Whatfix can help address your digital adoption challenges and achieve your business goals. Before we dive in, I just want to confirm that we have all the stakeholders present from the Marks and Spencer's side. Can you please introduce yourselves?
Yes, we're all here. I'm John, the IT Director, and I have my team members, Rachel from Customer Experience and Michael from Training and Development.

Great, thank you, John. So, as we discussed during our discovery call, you're facing some challenges in maintaining customer loyalty, staying ahead of the competition, and ensuring a seamless customer experience across various channels. Whatfix can help you overcome these challenges with our digital adoption platform. Let me show you how.

Our platform offers a no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application, which looks 100% native. This feature can help you simplify complex user interfaces and reduce the time it takes for your customers to achieve their desired outcomes. Let me show you a demo.

As you can see, our in-app guidance feature is highly customizable and can be tailored to fit your brand's look and feel. We've seen our customers achieve significant ROI from using this feature, with a 30% increase in user adoption and a 25% reduction in support requests.

messages.user: Marks and Spencer's Customer Experience Manager
messages.content: That's impressive. But how do you address the concern of change management? We've had issues with adoption rates in the past.

I completely understand your concern, Rachel. That's why we offer a comprehensive onboarding process, including dedicated customer success managers, training, and support resources. We'll work closely with your team to ensure a smooth transition and provide ongoing support to guarantee your success.

In addition to our in-app guidance feature, our analytics module provides insights on user behavior to optimize the application experience. This feature can help you identify areas of friction and opportunity to improve the overall user experience.

messages.user: Marks and Spencer's Training and Development Manager
messages.content: I'm interested in learning more about your interactive guides feature. Can you show us how that works?

Absolutely, Michael. Our interactive guides feature provides step-by-step instructions to help users complete tasks efficiently. This feature can be particularly useful for complex workflows or onboarding processes. Let me show you a demo.

As you can see, our interactive guides feature is highly engaging and can be customized to fit your specific business needs. We've seen our customers achieve significant reductions in training time and costs by using this feature.
I have to say, I'm impressed with what I've seen so far. But how do you differentiate yourselves from competitors like WalkMe and Pendo?

That's a great question, John. While our competitors may offer similar features, our unique differentiator is our ability to provide a seamless, 100% native in-app experience. Our platform is designed to be highly customizable and adaptable to your specific business needs. Additionally, our customer success team is dedicated to ensuring your success and providing ongoing support to guarantee ROI.
Before we conclude, I just want to confirm that we've addressed all your pain points and concerns. Are there any other questions or areas you'd like to discuss further?

messages.user: Marks and Spencer's Customer Experience Manager
messages.content: Actually, I do have one more question. Can you provide some case studies or success stories from similar organizations in the retail industry?

Absolutely, Rachel. We've worked with several organizations in the retail industry, including [similar organization], which saw a 30% increase in user adoption and a 25% reduction in support requests after implementing our platform. I can provide you with a case study and some references if you'd like.

In terms of next steps, I'd like to propose a customized ROI model based on your specific needs and goals. We can work together to develop a plan that addresses your pain points and ensures tangible business outcomes. What are your thoughts?
That sounds like a great plan. We'll need to discuss this further internally, but we're interested in moving forward with the next steps. Thank you for the demo today.

You're welcome, John. I'll send over the presentation and any supporting materials we discussed today. I look forward to hearing back from you soon and working together to achieve your business goals.
